snippet: Activists said the ruling was another setback for gay men and lesbians in the country, widely viewed as the most repressive in Africa when it comes to prosecuting same-sex couples.
abstract: Appeals court in Cameroon upholds three-year sentence against Jean-Claude Roger Mbede, who was found guilty of homosexual conduct for sending text message professing his love for another man.
lead_paragraph: Activists said the ruling was another setback for gay men and lesbians in the country, widely viewed as the most repressive in Africa when it comes to prosecuting same-sex couples.

headline.seo: Gay Man’s 3-Year Sentence Is Upheld by Cameroon Court
headline.main: Gay Man’s 3-Year Sentence Upheld by Cameroon Court
headline.print_headline: Gay Man’s 3-Year Sentence Upheld by Cameroon Court
